meanings.definition: Capable of catching fire and burning.
meanings.sent1: The dry leaves were highly combustive and caught fire easily.
meanings.sent2: The combustive material ignited quickly in the presence of a spark.
meanings.sent3: The campfire was so combustive that it seemed to dance with excitement.
meanings.sent4: Her anger was like a combustive force, ready to explode at any moment.
meanings.sent5: The combustive nature of the fireworks lit up the night sky in a dazzling display.

meanings.sent1: Leaving a combustive substance near an open flame is dangerous.
meanings.sent2: The combustive chemicals in the lab required careful handling.
meanings.sent3: The combustive mix of ingredients in the kitchen created a delicious aroma.
meanings.sent4: His words had a combustive effect, stirring up emotions in the crowd.
meanings.sent5: The combustive reaction between the two elements produced a lot of heat.

meanings.sent1: The combustive process of burning wood releases heat and light.
meanings.sent2: The engine's combustive cycle powers the vehicle forward.
meanings.sent3: The combustive nature of the volcano made it a sight to behold.
meanings.sent4: The combustive energy of the sun fuels life on Earth.
meanings.sent5: The combustive reaction in the rocket propelled it into space.
